page.title: 09Farming In South Kyme-1
page.content: Land is ploughed or cultivated straight after harvest, then oil seed rape is drilled, potatoes lifted, fields worked and winter wheat and barley drilled. Pellets are spread to kill slugs, weeds are killed with sprays and crops are fed with fertilizer. Most farmers are unhappy with the Common Market. They think it encourages produce mountains & they fear we're going to have hard years, with prices low but costs high. They wish excess produce could go to famine areas. A few cattle are fattened, and some small farmers do contract work. { {CHANGES IN 25 YRS. Fields have increased from 18 to 50 acres. On 900 acre farms, tractors have increased from 4 in number to 12, but the workforce has fallen from 13 to 5. Average craftsmans' weekly wage is Â£120.
